channel.title: Virtual Machines on Harvester manual test cases
channel.description: Recent content in Virtual Machines on Harvester manual test cases

item.title: Add a network to an existing VM with only 1 network
item.description: Add a network to the VM Save the VM Wait for it to start/restart Expected Results the VM should start successfully The already existing network connectivity should still work The new connectivity should also work

item.title: Add a network to an existing VM with two networks
item.description: Add a network to the VM Save the VM Wait for it to start/restart Expected Results the VM should start successfully The already existing network connectivity should still work The new connectivity should also work

item.title: Clone VM and don't select start after creation
item.description: Clone VM from Virtual Machine list Expected Results Machine should start if start VM after creation was checked Machine should match the origin machine in Config In YAML You should be able to connect to new VM via console

item.title: Clone VM that is turned off
item.description: Clone VM from Virtual Machine list that is turned off Expected Results Machine should start if start VM after creation was checked Machine should match the origin machine in Config In YAML You should be able to connect to new VM via console

item.title: Clone VM that is turned on
item.description: Clone VM from Virtual Machine list that is turned on Expected Results Machine should start if start VM after creation was checked Machine should match the origin machine in Config In YAML You should be able to connect to new VM via console

item.title: Clone VM that was created from image
item.description: Clone VM from Virtual Machine list Expected Results Machine should start if start VM after creation was checked Machine should match the origin machine in Config In YAML You should be able to connect to new VM via console

item.title: Clone VM that was created from template
item.description: Clone VM from Virtual Machine list Expected Results Machine should start if start VM after creation was checked Machine should match the origin machine in Config In YAML You should be able to connect to new VM via console

item.title: Clone VM that was not created from image
item.description: Clone VM from Virtual Machine list Expected Results Machine should start if start VM after creation was checked Machine should match the origin machine in Config In YAML You should be able to connect to new VM via console

item.title: Create a new VM and add Enable usb tablet option
item.description: Add Enable usb tablet Option Save/Create VM Expected Results Machine starts successfully Enable usb tablet shows In YAML In Form

item.title: Create a new VM and add Install guest agent option
item.description: Add install Guest Agent Option Save/Create VM Validate that qemu-guest-agent was installed You can do this on ubuntu with the command dpkg -l | grep qemu Expected Results Machine starts successfully Guest Agent Option shows In YAML In Form Guest Agent is installed

item.title: Create a new VM with Network Data from the form
item.description: Add Network Data to the VM Here is an example of Network Data config to add DHCP to the physical interface eth0 network: version: 1 config: - type: physical name: eth0 subnets: - type: dhcp Save/Create the VM Expected Results Machine starts succesfully Network Data should show in YAML Network Datashould show in Form Machine should have DHCP for network on eth0

item.title: Create a new VM with Network Data from YAML
item.description: Add Network Data to the VM via YAML Here is an example of Network Data config to add DHCP to the physical interface eth0 network: version: 1 config: - type: physical name: eth0 subnets: - type: dhcp Save/Create the VM Expected Results Machine starts succesfully Network Data should show in YAML Network Datashould show in Form Machine should have DHCP for network on eth0

item.title: Create a new VM with User Data from the form
item.description: Add User data to the VM Here is an example of user data config to add a password #cloud-config password: password chpasswd: {expire: False} sshpwauth: True Save/Create the VM Expected Results Machine starts succesfully User data should exist In YAML In Form Machine should have user password set

item.title: Create a VM on a VLAN with an existing machine and then change the existing machine's VLAN
item.description: Create/edit VM/VMs with the appropriate VLAN Change VLAN for VM if appropriate Expected Results VM should create successfully Appropriate VLAN should show In config in YAML VMs should NOT be able to connect on network verify with ping/ICMP verify with SSH verify with telnet over port 80 if there’s a web server

item.title: Create a VM with 2 networks
item.description: Add a network to the VM Save the VM Wait for it to start/restart Expected Results the VM should start successfully The already existing network connectivity should still work The new connectivity should also work Comments one default management network and one VLAN

item.title: Create a vm with all the default values
item.description: Create a VM with all default values Save Expected Results VM should save VM should start if start after creation checkbox is checked Config should show In Form In YAML

item.title: Create a VM with Start VM on Creation checked
item.description: Create VM Expected Results VM should start Checkbox for start virtual machine on creation should show as appropriate while editing machine after creation

item.title: Create a VM with start VM on creation unchecked
item.description: Create VM Expected Results VM should start or not start as appropriate Checkbox for start virtual machine on creation should show as appropriate while editing machine after creation

item.title: Create multiple instances of the vm with ISO image
item.description: Create images using the external path for ISO image. In user data mention the below to access the vm. #cloud-config password: password chpasswd: {expire: False} sshpwauth: True Create the 3 vms and wait for vm to start Expected Results 3 vm should come up and start with same config. Observe the time taken for the system to start the vms. Observe the pattern of the vms get allocated on the nodes.

item.title: Create multiple instances of the vm with raw image
item.description: Create images using the external path for cloud image. In user data mention the below to access the vm. #cloud-config password: password chpasswd: {expire: False} sshpwauth: True Create the 3 vms and wait for vm to start. Expected Results 3 vm should come up and start with same config. Observe the time taken for the system to start the vms. Observe the pattern of the vms get allocated on the nodes.

item.title: Create multiple instances of the vm with Windows Image
item.description: Create images using the external path for ISO image. In user data mention the below to access the vm. #cloud-config password: password chpasswd: {expire: False} sshpwauth: True Create the 3 vms and wait for vm to start. Expected Results 3 vm should come up and start with same config. Observe the time taken for the system to start the vms. Observe the pattern of the vms get allocated on the nodes.

item.title: Create new VM with a machine type of PC
item.description: Set up the VM with the appropriate machine type Save/create Expected Results Machine should start sucessfully Machine should show the new machine type in the config and in the YAML

item.title: Create new VM with a machine type of q35
item.description: Set up the VM with the appropriate machine type Save/create Expected Results Machine should start sucessfully Machine should show the new machine type in the config and in the YAML

item.title: Create one VM on a VLAN and then move another VM to that VLAN
item.description: Create/edit VM/VMs with the appropriate VLAN Expected Results VM should create successfully Appropriate VLAN should show In config in YAML VMs should be able to connect on network This can be verified with a ping over the IP, or via other options if ICMP is disabled

item.title: Create one VM on a VLAN that has other VMs then change it to a different VLAN
item.description: Create/edit VM/VMs with the appropriate VLAN Change VLAN for VM if appropriate Expected Results VM should create successfully Appropriate VLAN should show In config in YAML VMs should NOT be able to connect on network verify with ping/ICMP verify with SSH verify with telnet over port 80 if there’s a web server

item.title: Create Single instances of the vm with ISO image
item.description: Create vm using the external path for ISO image. In user data mention the below to access the vm. #cloud-config password: password chpasswd: {expire: False} sshpwauth: True Create the vm and wait for vm to start. Expected Results VM should come up and start with same config.

item.title: Create Single instances of the vm with ISO image
item.description: Create vm using the external path for ISO image. In user data mention the below to access the vm. #cloud-config password: password chpasswd: {expire: False} sshpwauth: True Create the vm and wait for vm to start. Expected Results VM should come up and start with same config.

item.title: Create Single instances of the vm with ISO image with machine type pc
item.description: Create vm using the external path for ISO image. In user data mention the below to access the vm. #cloud-config password: password chpasswd: {expire: False} sshpwauth: True Create the vm and wait for vm to start. Expected Results VM should come up and start with same config.

item.title: Create Single instances of the vm with raw image
item.description: Create vm using the external path for cloud image. In user data mention the below to access the vm. #cloud-config password: password chpasswd: {expire: False} sshpwauth: True Create the vm and wait for vm to start. Expected Results VM should come up and start with same config.

item.title: Create Single instances of the vm with Windows Image
item.description: Create vm using the external path for ISO image. In user data mention the below to access the vm. #cloud-config password: password chpasswd: {expire: False} sshpwauth: True Create the vm and wait for vm to start. Expected Results VM should come up and start with same config.

item.title: Create two VMs in the same VLAN
item.description: Create/edit VM/VMs with the appropriate VLAN Expected Results VM should create successfully Appropriate VLAN should show In config in YAML VMs should be able to connect on network This can be verified with a ping over the IP, or via other options if ICMP is disabled

item.title: Create two VMs on separate VLANs
item.description: Create/edit VM/VMs with the appropriate VLAN Change VLAN for VM if appropriate Expected Results VM should create successfully Appropriate VLAN should show In config in YAML VMs should NOT be able to connect on network verify with ping/ICMP verify with SSH verify with telnet over port 80 if there’s a web server

item.title: Create two VMs on the same VLAN and change one
item.description: Create/edit VM/VMs with the appropriate VLAN Change VLAN for VM if appropriate Expected Results VM should create successfully Appropriate VLAN should show In config in YAML VMs should NOT be able to connect on network verify with ping/ICMP verify with SSH verify with telnet over port 80 if there’s a web server

item.title: Create VM and add SSH key
item.description: Create VM Add SSH key if not already in VM Logon with SSH Expected Results You should be prompted for SSH key passphrase if appropriate You should connect You should be able to execute shell commands The SSH Key should show in the SSH key list

item.title: Create vm using a template of default version
item.description: Create a new VM with a template of default version Expected Results After selecting appropriate template and/or version it should populate other fields CPU, Memory, Image, and SSH key should match saved template info VM should start after creation if Start Virtual Machine is selected

item.title: Create vm using a template of default version with machine type pc
item.description: Create a new VM with a template of default version Expected Results After selecting appropriate template and/or version it should populate other fields CPU, Memory, Image, and SSH key should match saved template info VM should start after creation if Start Virtual Machine is selected

item.title: Create vm using a template of default version with machine type q35
item.description: Create a new VM with a template of default version Expected Results After selecting appropriate template and/or version it should populate other fields CPU, Memory, Image, and SSH key should match saved template info VM should start after creation if Start Virtual Machine is selected

item.title: Create vm using a template of non-default version
item.description: Create a new VM with a template of non-default version Expected Results After selecting appropriate template and/or version it should populate other fields CPU, Memory, Image, and SSH key should match saved template info VM should start after creation if Start Virtual Machine is selected

item.title: Create vm with both CPU and Memory not in cluster
item.description: Attempt to create a VM with the appropriate resources Expected Results You should get errors for each resource you over provisioned The VM should not create until errors are resolved

item.title: Create vm with CPU not in cluster.
item.description: Attempt to create a VM with the appropriate resources Expected Results You should get errors for each resource you over provisioned The VM should not create until errors are resolved

item.title: Create VM with existing Volume
item.description: Create VM with an existing volume Expected Results VM should create and start You should be able to open the console for the VM and see it boot Volume should show in volumes list VM should appear to the “Attached VM” column of the existing volume

item.title: Create vm with Memory not in cluster.
item.description: Attempt to create a VM with the appropriate resources Expected Results You should get errors for each resource you over provisioned The VM should not create until errors are resolved

item.title: Create VM with resources that are only on one node in cluster CPU
item.description: Create a VM with resources that are only available on one node in cluster Expected Results VM should create VM should be assigned to node that has available resources VM should boot VM should pass health checks

item.title: Create VM with resources that are only on one node in cluster CPU
item.description: Edit a VM with resources that are only available on one node in cluster. Expected Results VM should save VM should be reassigned to node that has available resources VM should boot VM should pass health checks

item.title: Create VM with resources that are only on one node in cluster CPU and Memory
item.description: Create a VM with resources that are only available on one node in cluster Expected Results VM should create VM should be assigned to node that has available resources VM should boot VM should pass health checks

item.title: Create VM with resources that are only on one node in cluster Memory
item.description: Create a VM with resources that are only available on one node in cluster Expected Results VM should create VM should be assigned to node that has available resources VM should boot VM should pass health checks

item.title: Create VM with resources that are only on one node in cluster Memory
item.description: Edit a VM with resources that are only available on one node in cluster. Expected Results VM should save VM should be reassigned to node that has available resources VM should boot VM should pass health checks

item.title: Create VM with saved SSH key
item.description: Create VM Add SSH key if not already in VM Logon with SSH Expected Results You should be prompted for SSH key passphrase if appropriate You should connect You should be able to execute shell commands The SSH Key should show in the SSH key list

item.title: Create VM with the default network
item.description: Create a VM with the default network Let VM boot up after creation Expected Results VM should start VM should be able to ping other machines in the VLAN VM should be able to ping servers on the internet if the VLAN has external access

item.title: Create VM with two disk volumes
item.description: Create a VM with the appropriate number of volumes Expected Results Verify after creation that the appropriate volumes are in the config for the VM Verify that the volumes are created and listed in the volumes section

item.title: Delete multiple VMs with disks
item.description: Delete VM Select whether you want to delete disks Expected Results You should check amount of used space on Server before you delete the VM Machine should delete It should not show up in the Virtual Machine list Disks should be listed/or not in Volumes list as appropriate Verify the cleaned up the space on the disk on the node.

item.title: Delete multiple VMs without disks
item.description: Delete VM Select whether you want to delete disks Expected Results You should check amount of used space on Server before you delete the VM Machine should delete It should not show up in the Virtual Machine list Disks should be listed/or not in Volumes list as appropriate Verify the cleaned up the space on the disk on the node.

item.title: Delete single vm all disks
item.description: Delete VM Select whether you want to delete disks Expected Results You should check amount of used space on Server before you delete the VM Machine should delete It should not show up in the Virtual Machine list Disks should be listed/or not in Volumes list as appropriate Verify the cleaned up the space on the disk on the node.

item.title: Delete VM Negative
item.description: In a multi-node setup disconnect/shutdown the node where the VM is running Delete VM and all disks Expected Results You should not be able to delete the VM

item.title: Edit a VM and add install Enable usb tablet option
item.description: Add Enable usb tablet Option Save/Create VM Expected Results Machine starts successfully Enable usb tablet shows In YAML In Form

item.title: Edit a VM and add install guest agent option
item.description: Add install Guest Agent Option Save/Create VM Expected Results Machine starts successfully Guest Agent Option shows In YAML In Form Guest Agent is installed

item.title: Edit a VM from the form to add Network Data
item.description: Add Network Data to the VM Here is an example of Network Data config to add DHCP to the physical interface eth0 network: version: 1 config: - type: physical name: eth0 subnets: - type: dhcp Save/Create the VM Expected Results Machine starts succesfully Network Data should show in YAML Network Datashould show in Form Machine should have DHCP for network on eth0

item.title: Edit a VM from the form to add user data
item.description: Add User data to the VM Here is an example of user data config to add a password `` #cloud-config password: password chpasswd: {expire: False} sshpwauth: True Save/Create the VM Expected Results Machine starts succesfully User data should In YAML In Form Machine should have user password set

item.title: Edit a VM from the YAML to add Network Data
item.description: Add Network Data to the VM Here is an example of Network Data config to add DHCP to the physical interface eth0 network: version: 1 config: - type: physical name: eth0 subnets: - type: dhcp Save/Create the VM Expected Results Machine starts succesfully Network Data should show in YAML Network Datashould show in Form Machine should have DHCP for network on eth0

item.title: Edit a VM from the YAML to add user data
item.description: Add User data to the VM Here is an example of user data config to add a password `` #cloud-config password: password chpasswd: {expire: False} sshpwauth: True Save/Create the VM Expected Results Machine starts succesfully User data should In YAML In Form Machine should have user password set

item.title: Edit an existing VM to another machine type
item.description: Set up the VM with the appropriate machine type Save/create Expected Results Machine should start sucessfully Machine should show the new machine type in the config and in the YAML

item.title: Edit vm and insert ssh and check the ssh key is accepted for the login
item.description: Edit VM and add SSH Key Save VM Expected Results You should be able to ssh in with correct SSH private key You should not be able to SSH in with incorrect SSH private key

item.title: Edit VM Form Negative
item.description: In a multi-node setup disconnect/shutdown the node where the VM is running Edit the VM via form Save the VM Expected Results You should not be able to save the edited Form You should get an error

item.title: Edit vm network and verify the network is working as per configuration
item.description: Edit VM network Save Expected Results VM should save VM should restart if restart checkbox is checked Changes should show In Form In YAML Network should function as desired

item.title: Edit VM via form with CPU
item.description: Edit VM Save Expected Results VM should save VM should restart if restart checkbox is checked Changes should show In Form In YAML

item.title: Edit VM via form with CPU and Memory
item.description: Edit VM Save Expected Results VM should save VM should restart if restart checkbox is checked Changes should show In Form In YAML

item.title: Edit VM via form with Memory
item.description: Edit VM Save Expected Results VM should save VM should restart if restart checkbox is checked Changes should show In Form In YAML

item.title: Edit VM via YAML with CPU
item.description: Edit VM Save Expected Results VM should save VM should restart if restart checkbox is checked Changes should show In Form In YAML

item.title: Edit VM via YAML with CPU and Memory
item.description: Edit VM Save Expected Results VM should save VM should restart if restart checkbox is checked Changes should show In Form In YAML

item.title: Edit VM via YAML with Memory
item.description: Edit VM Save Expected Results VM should save VM should restart if restart checkbox is checked Changes should show In Form In YAML

item.title: Edit VM with resources that are only on one node in cluster CPU and Memory
item.description: Edit a VM with resources that are only available on one node in cluster. Expected Results VM should save VM should be reassigned to node that has available resources VM should boot VM should pass health checks

item.title: Edit VM YAML Negative
item.description: In a multi-node setup disconnect/shutdown the node where the VM is running Edit the VM via YAML Save the VM Expected Results SSH to the node and check the nodes has components deleted.

item.title: Run multiple instances of the console
item.description: Open up the console on two browsers to simulate multiple connections Login with both browsers create a new file on both instances Edit the file from the other instance and save Verify that you can see the changes from the other instance Expected Results You should be able to login from multiple browsers File should create File should update You should be able to see changes from all instances

item.title: Start VM and stop node Negative
item.description: Start the VM In a multi-node setup disconnect/shutdown the node where the VM is running Expected Results You should not be able to start the VM

item.title: Start VM Negative
item.description: In a multi-node setup disconnect/shutdown the node where the VM is running Start the VM Expected Results You should not be able to start the VM

item.title: Stop VM Negative
item.description: In a multi-node setup disconnect/shutdown the node where the VM is running Stop the VM Expected Results The VM list should quickly update to not running, or some other error state

item.title: Verify operations like Stop, restart, pause, download Yaml, generate template
item.description: Take an existing VM and Press the appropriate buttons for the associated operations Stop Restart Pause Download YAML Generate Template Expected Results All operations should complete successfully
